items.sentence: Tom went on talking as if Mary wasn't there.
If Tom wants to do something, let him do it.
Tom and Mary admired the landscape together.
I know Tom isn't the one who should do that.
I know Tom isn't going to help Mary do that.
I know Tom isn't going to do that with Mary.
I know Tom isn't flexible enough to do that.
I know Tom is the kind of guy who'd do that.
I know Tom is likely to know how to do that.
I know Tom is having a hard time doing that.
I know Tom is going to learn how to do that.
I know Tom hasn't yet asked Mary to do that.
Tom said he was too busy to help me do that.
Tom said Mary doesn't want to do that today.
Tom said that he thinks that he can do that.
Tom said that he plans to do that on Monday.
I don't really want to learn how to do that.
I have no idea when I'm supposed to do that.
There's a good chance that Tom will do that.
There's a very good chance Tom will do that.
